com.intel.jndn.utils.client

Class FutureData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.jndn.utils.client.FutureDataBase
      • com.intel.jndn.utils.client.FutureData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Future<net.named_data.jndn.Data>

    public class FutureData
extends FutureDataBase
    Reference to a Packet that has yet to be returned from the network. Usage: 
    
 FutureData futureData = new FutureData(face, interest.getName());
 face.expressInterest(interest, new OnData(){
        ... futureData.resolve(data); ...
 }, new OnTimeout(){
  ... futureData.reject(new TimeoutException());
 });
 Data resolvedData = futureData.get(); // will block and call face.processEvents() until complete
    Author:
    Andrew Brown

      • resolve

        public void resolve(net.named_data.jndn.Data returnedData)
        Set the packet when successfully retrieved; unblocks FutureDataBase.get(). Use this method inside an OnData callback to resolve this future.
        Parameters:
        returnedData - the Data returned from the network

      • isResolved

        public boolean isResolved()
        Returns:
        true if the Data has returned and been resolved with resolve(net.named_data.jndn.Data).
